title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: On the right of the king, who was splendidly armed, and rode atall grey horse, presented to him by Lord Lindsay, was that venerablewarrior and the Earl of Crawford, commanding a noble body of cavalry,consisting of the chivalry of Fife and Angus; while on his left LordRuthven, with the men of Strathearn and Stormont, formed a body ofnearly five thousand spearmen.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: On the right of the king, who was splendidly armed, and rode atall grey horse, presented to him by Lord Lindsay, was that venerablewarrior and the Earl of Crawford, commanding a noble body of cavalry,consisting of the chivalry of Fife and Angus; while on his left LordRuthven, with the men of Strathearn and Stormont, formed a body ofnearly five thousand spearmen.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: To the right wesaw the Stormont and Strathtay.

title: The historical works of Sir James Balfour.
author: Balfour, James
snippet: The 13 of Maij, 1639, deyed Ladey Anna Murray, Wisceuniesse of Stormont, 2d sister te SrAndrew Murray of Balwaird, knight, and wyffe toMungo Murray, Wiscount of Stormont, Lerd Scene,by quhome shoe had no issew.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The Earl of Crawford and Loid David Lindsay, with themen of Fife and Angus, had the right wing ; Lord Ruthven commanded the left,with the people of Stratheam and Stormont.
